page.title: 04Victoria Park Grounds
page.content: {Recreation:Victoria Park Grounds } Victoria Park opened in 1901. The Park is 25 acres in size.There are only nine gardeners to look after the Park.When the flowers have been dug up,the gardeners dispose of them. They cut the grass whenever necessary. The flowers are changed twice a year, in the autumn and in the summer. The Park Superintendent tells the gardeners what to plant. The whole of the south Sefton area is supplied with flowers from the greenhouses at the Park.When the Queen visited Southport,the station was decorated with plants from here.Most of the plants are grown from seed.The greenhouses used to be heated by solid fuel,then oil and now they use gas.Aliquid called "Summer Cloud" is painted on the greenhouses to protect the plants.
